intro: Hieracium auriculiforme subsp. coryphodes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of many small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and hairy. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from June to August. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
